REVIEW_BODY: Cant find much interesting here. I hope this is the only mount available in Singapore. Only attraction i can see is we can have a view of Indonesia from here using the telescopes available there in the park.

A very nice green space with in the city to hangout and also get wonderful views of the city. You can zoom in to the views using the telescope placed there. You can understand why Singapore is called a city in a garden. I went there by the cable car. You can also reach there by bus/car. Or even take a hike from downhill. The views and atmosphere is certainly worth it.
Mt Faber is a pleasant place to have a wander and the views are superb. It is best to get there by cable car. There is also the Bell of Happiness which is near the cable car station. Worth a visit.
Im not really into heigh, but how could u reach here, without using the cable car! But once u get there everything is so nice, u must try the cafe, food is delicious

This is final destination if you walked along Southern Ridges - best free views over city and if you want then can take cable car to Sentosa. We saw one gigantic spider but otherwise Central Water Catchment walking trails have much more fun.

Going to Arbour next Sunday for lunch with my family of 14 to celebrate my son's graduation. I hope food will be good, just like the view and everyone will have an enjoyable afternoon. Will update more, after our visit.
Mount Faber is good for trekking, hiking and long walks. One must visit the place and get a glimpse of the city from a height.
This place can give you scope for relaxing with nature. Area is quite green & can be visited for one to two hours.
It is the small hill in comparison with other mountains. However, in Singapore it is rare. This place is maintained well & can be visited for few hours.

Amazing breath taking views from the top. You have to use the Singapore cable car line to get to the top from Harbourfront station. you can f=buy cheap tickets for the cable car online thru websites like KLOOK which i used. enjoy
Good place to have a wide view to the city, Sentosa and the sea. There's not thing much to do but taking photos.

A great place for hiking and enjoy the fresh air and scenic view. The new bridge give another great view where you may find breathe taking discoveries. There is cable car station where you can take to travel to Sentosa island. A convenient and provide a bird eye view.

Loved the restaurant around the tree, and the amazing views over Sentosa and the harbour. Great start to the cable car-sentosa-harbour front experience. Have a look at the quirky railing of bells, reminds you of the love bridge in Paris.
Took the cable car from the harbour up to mount Faber. Very pleasant and ate at the restaurant with a beautiful view.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great views - catch the cable car to Sentosa Island
REVIEW_BODY: We took a taxi to the top of Mount Faber and took in the views of Sentosa Island and Singapore. Great views in early morning. The cable car ticket office opened at 8:45am. Took the cable car to Sentosa Island for the day. Returned to Harbour Front cable car station as better option to catch a taxi. Definitely worth a look.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great view over the city & Sentosa Island
REVIEW_BODY:
We took the gondola up to Mt Fabor. Great views and they had a cute terrace hung with wishing bells. If you venture further through their garden at the top, you will come to an original old sailing ship’s bell which is meant to grant lifelong happiness when couples ring it together. If you walk up to the top of the mountain, you get great views of Sentosa Island, the original Merlion (the sign for prosperity) which guards over the trading ship harbor, and views of Singapore city.
You can then take the gondola on a round trip to Sentosa Island which has a uniqueness including an alley towards the beach which you would think Gaudi had developed and designed! Definitely worth the trip!
Glad to know this place for daily acitivty to do relaxation, Viewing and exercise running/walking. We are take cable car from sentosa to stop at Mount Faber

I have a faber Licence, that is, the one that gives me unlimited rides on all cable cars in Singapore. My 16 month old loves the rides, and I find it gives her a bird's eye view, a different perspective to her environment.

We eventually made it to try dusk restaurant at dusk hah! Didn't watch the sunset as we left early to head home to put little one to bed after a tiring afternoon at sentosa. Very expensive tapas! Good quality but small portions. The dusk promotion is awesome for wines though. The moscato was good!

The park has very good panoramuc view and has cablecar transport to Sentosa. Walk to Faber point it is only 7 minutes walk from cablecar station. It definitely worth it.
At this point you can take a picture with Merlion statue.
Don't miss the Happiness Bell at the back of the cablecar station.
We bought tickets (one direction is not available) to Sentosa. We took tickets for in-island circle (i think it is unnecessary).
You can walk or take shuttle to "Wave house". Free if you use the atraction (highly recommended) or eat at the restaurant.
The view from the cablecar is unic and you can order VIP meal.
start at morning. you can spend all day at Sentosa (look for 'Sentosa').

Free car parks and good exercise

There are different car parks at different sites too.

Henderson wave is nearest to car park D

Worthwhile to visit the cable car building where there is a nice gift shop and beautiful photo spots. There is also bell of happiness and the ‘wishing’ bells

Wear sport shoes and comfy clothes
This is one of the best place to get a good view of Singapore. Make sure you visit it in either the morning hours or the evening. The view is worth the trip.

Mount Faber is located close to the Vivo City mall and one can take the cable car ride from here to Sentosa island. It is preferable to take a cab to Mount Faber as there is no bus service to the top. The views from atop the peak are good and offer great background for good photos.

This is supposedly the highest peak of Singapore which is not too high in normal standard. But even then it offers a very good panoramic view of the city, u can take the cable car to Sentosa from here which is why most people visit it.

Came here again on the weekend with the kids. Great views out over Sentosa and the city. A bit of a pain to get to by public transport, but easy by taxi or your own car. We come here fairly regularly as it's the boarding point for the cable car to Sentosa.

A walk up to the top is compensated with the magnificent view of Singapore City. The peak is surrounded with a large park where one can go for a walk or jog.There are a few options to have a bite if needed.And one can take a Cable Car ride from here.

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth It for the Panoramic Views
REVIEW_BODY: I love views and this is a great spot for just that. The view is panoramic, overlooking southern Singapore, the cable cars, Sentosa Island, and over to Indonesia. There are many lookout points with telescopes that provide for a closer view. We went with a guide for a tour of the island so we drove to the top. It is a great photo opportunity. Photos and View!

The mount in the island city Singapore is attractive in its kind near Harbourfront surrounded by forest area a very good atraction. If you have time you nay visit by cable car. There is a viewing gallery on the top of the mount from where the whole island can be seen it is said you can see the border of indonesia.

Mount Faber Peak is where you can find an old bridge full of little bells with wishes written on them. The bell of happiness is then rang to answer your wishes. This was a great experience and yes I definitely made a wish on a bell. This is located just behind the cable cars so you cannot miss it.
Kids loved the cable car rides and views from the top... This is a must go on your way to Sentosa and gives a good view of the entire theme park...!!!
Romantic mount for all ages you can see Singapore from up with nice road teaching the TOP enjoying the beauty of the nature and sea view Good experience
Think its the highest peak in Singapore and you can take a cable car from here to Sentosa Island . Also you can have nice views from the top

REVIEW_TITLE: Only way to visit Sentosa Island
REVIEW_BODY: This is easily the best way to visit Sentosa Island. Get on at the Mt Faber entry point and purchase a ticket which includes both cable cars on offer and includes return. You alight right in the heart of the action on Sentosa island. Once on the island you can get on the other cable car which takes you from Merlion station up to the fort at one end of the island. Beats the long walk and what a great view of the beaches and harbour with all the cargo ships.The views in all direction on bothe cable cars are breathtaking. it is well worth the outlay.

This is the highest point from where we can see the Sentosa island in full picture post card view . From here the cable cars to Sentosa island starts . It is really beautiful on a clear day to view the whole city . And nice to walk on a cool Breeze day .

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place for an easy morning hike, with amazing view from an unlikely spot
REVIEW_BODY: This was a nice place to take an easy hike even with young children. It the was raining lightly the day we went, but still enjoyed the visit. One of the Singapore Cable Car stations is located here. The kids enjoyed the koi pond as other reviews mentioned, and we saw the array of happiness bells. I encountered the best view of the Singapore Cable Cars from an unexpected place - inside the ladies' restroom! Sure enough, other visitors to the restroom stood in front of the floor to ceiling window facing Sentosa exclaiming over the view. And might I add, the arrangement of modern pedestal sinks in a circle with the large fish tank off to the side was pretty photogenic too. (I cannot comment on the views from the men's room, but it is right next door).

REVIEW_TITLE: Another park but on a hill
REVIEW_BODY: By itself, it's basically a park to walk around and see the western side of Singapore from atop the hill. Nothing much special for tourists.
It is free and easy to get to. You get a good view of the city and Sentosa island. Suitable for budget travelers who dont want to use the cable car.

Mount Faber has a great view of Sentosa and the city (even seeing Marina Bay Sands). There are a few nice restaurants and a nice cafe as well. There is of course the world's most iconic toilet which have also a good view of the city.

REVIEW_TITLE: Wonderful breeze and views of surroundings
REVIEW_BODY:
This is the highest point in Singapore, Bukit Timah Hill. This location offers a
Surround view of 360 degrees, from the pier to the surrounding estates. Many coach buses stop here. Just about 100m down the path is a pub restaurant. It offers great sunset views and especially later into the night with the night lights. Romantic for couples to take a walk here

Parked here and caught the cable car to Sentosa Island. Glad I didn't go only for Mt Faber. Yes you an see a long way, either the docks or Sentosa Island. Would be great place to walk or run for exercise, but for a tourist attraction there's nothing there.

We caught the Cable Car from Mount Faber to Sentosa Island. We caught a cab from our hotel to Mount Faber.

This is a great way to see a lot.

The Cable Cars are not air conditioned, but you can open windows to let air in.

We loved the view.

Staff were also good.

They do take your photo so be prepared at the other end when they show you your photo, it was either $25 or $35 for the photo - you don't have to buy it.

We took the cable car in the evening to enjoy the views. We had booked tickets on my phone and had trouble opening our e-tickets at the ticket booth. The young man serving, Kelvin, was so very helpful and allowed us to hotspot his phone to get better internet to open our tickets. Very kind and a great service! The view from the main cable car is wonderful on sunset and in the evening but we were a bit disappointed in the island cable cars. They are very hot (even after dark, no fans!) and are so heavily tinted that there isn’t much of a view. We think it’s definitely worth the trip from Faber to Sentosa and back though, the view is awesome!
Mount Faber is the highest point in Singapore! It sits on the Southern Ridges with fantastic views to the south. We walked up, but you can catch a cable car to the top of the hill!
One of the hills found on this small island called Singapore. There are a number of restaurants located here. The cable car to sentosa also starts here. The views at the top is mesmerizing.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great place for the city view
REVIEW_BODY: It is an excellent location for viewing the city. There is lot of opportunity to walk around if you enjoy walking

This is a great place to come for some really nice views of the city. We didn’t take the cable car but there was still loads to see especially at Faber point which was beautiful and gave you 360 views of the city.
If you are visiting Singapore then I highly recommend the cablecar amazing views plus a great way to visit all the attractions on Sentosa island.

Mount Faber offers an excellent view over Singapore. It has manicured lawns and garden. However, unfortunately we were given incorrect information to get to the summit. On alighting from our public transport bus, we were faced (without being warned) with a very long walk up a steep gradient. Not good for the elderly or people, like me, with breathing difficulty. I'm uncertain what alternative access there is. In summary, I would recommend Mount Faber for those reasonably fit, or those who must catch the Sentosa Cable Car there. There is a much more accessible Cable Car Station at the Harbour Front.
Lovely restaurant at the top which is great for a drink and views of the harbour front. Accessible from the cable car or southern ridges walk. Peaceful and clean. Really under-rated!

Years ago I visited Mount Faber; Much has changed, a better access road, more development, bars, restaurants, hiking trails, and still great views over parts of the Island. It's one of the oldest parks in Singapore and the location where you take the cable-car to Sentosa Island.
Great views from this mountain before getting the cable car over to Sentosa. The view over the harbour and the island are sensational

Breath taking views of sentosa before the sun set and food was promptly served. The server was friendly and approachable. Advisable to book the tables in advance to enjoy a better view with lesser obstructions. A clearer signboard could be in place for better directions to the restaurant.

Beautiful place and view. The platter was good and was full just by having that. It is a nice place to bring ur loved ones to on a special place. Scenic view and at night with all the lights and the cable car view was very nice. There was a outdoor n indoor place.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice place to dine and chill
REVIEW_BODY: This place has got a nice view. A place that can be considered for any occasions, be it a romantic dinner, to a wedding or corporate events. Great food and service. Worth the trip up the winding road. Will definitely be back again.

Took the taxi to the top of Mt Faber and then did the walk right round and back out the other side. Lots of steps and hills and amazing views from all sides of Singapore. Tree top walks a great way to get your daily steps and more in

We walked to Mount Faber through the southern ridges walk, then took the cable car to Sentosa Island. We precooked online so got a discounted rate. We paid for both cable car lines which was well worth it as you got to see more of the island. The organisation and staff were brilliant, such an interesting and different way to see singapore!

REVIEW_TITLE: All you need to know about Scenic mount Faber
REVIEW_BODY:
* Singapore has two cable car lines and most popular one starts from Mount Faber to Sentosa via Harboutfront
* This place is well known for its natural beauty and wonderful restaurants who provide good food along with amazing view.
* There are many picture perfect points where you can take amazing pictures and selfies
* There is one bell of happiness whose beauty and glory will definitely bring smile on your face
* Not so popular tourist destination but it offers a lot to your memories
* It does not come on must visit list but definitely one of my favourites in Singapore . If you cherish nature and peace then definitely visit this place.
It was a short ride up to Mt Faber and the view was amazing. It started raining but it was still warm and the rain didn't last long.

REVIEW_TITLE: Stunning view and a lovely ride
REVIEW_BODY:
Mount Faber cable car – A great way to look around.
We arrived in Singapore late at night and so took the next day to travel by MRT to Mount Faber Park and its cable cars. Just take the MRT to The Harbourfront. The tickets are surprisingly cheap, especially when doubled up with the Sentosa Island ticket – a steal at S$22 each or about £12 each. The cable cars go really high up the mountain to a restaurant and some shops and offer some fantastic views both of the docks and waterfront and across to Sentosa and Singapore in the other direction. They are incredibly smooth cables – no rocking or jolting, and like everything in Singapore – very, very clean. You can get out at the top and spend time in the park a well.

From the overseas tourist perspective. Spectacular views in summary. For the extended view, starting at the Mount Faber peak is a family must do. In staying in the city precinct, suggest you catch taxi to Mount Faber which is not expensive and at the end of the day, on your return leg on the cable car stop at the harbour-front station, and a catch a taxi back to the city from Vivo-City shopping mall, which in itself is a good retail experience. Return taxis to the city from the Mount Faber station may be at a premium at day's end.

REVIEW_TITLE: Green hill with a few sights
REVIEW_BODY: You can take the slow cable car to go to mount faber or a taxi. On this hill you can walk around and take a picture with the bell of happiness. But besides that? Not much, in my opinion.

The view from Mt Faber is fantastic, well worth the effort to get to. There are a number of ways to come, but I always enjoyed the walk more than driving. It is a short climb from the Vivo shopping complex, or you could come any number of ways from Telok Blangah, including via Henderson waves from Telok Blangah Hill park. The view to Sentosa is great, as is the view of the harbour and the city. Worth a few hours at least, including a meal and /or drink at the cable car station.

REVIEW_TITLE: 1 of the better attractions in Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: I got married to my wife here on Mount Faber: do visit at night which is more romantic & stroll around to catch the nice views of the surrounding areas. This is one of the better natural "attractions" in Singapore which is very lacking! Will visit again in future to take some nice photos!!

Currently stood waiting to get a refund for tickets pre-purchased online. The line is closed today but they won't give us a refund. Apparently we can use the tickets any time in the next 3 months - great, but we leave Singapore today!

Total cowboys, avoid at all costs. 1 star because I have to!

Started off at Santosa island, it took us 30 mins to find the cable car entrance it was all very poorly sign posted. When we finally reached the ticket office we payed $84 for three of us to go up. The cable car took about 5 mins to reach mount Faber, after reading such good reviews we thought we should definitely visit, when we got off we were thoroughly disappointed we alighted straight into a restaurant, we walked through the restaurant as there was no other way of getting out, we were hoping maybe we would see a lovely view from the other side but there was nothing?! Literally nothing, no view either side and no clear walk ways. We didn't want to come hiking so I guess unless you wanted to hike here this was a complete waste of time and money! We got one picture in the restaurant of a bell and that was it! Stayed for 10 mins and headed back down.
The port of singapore is hardly visible from other parts of the city, here its quite nice to look out to. Also can take the cable car from here to sentosa, though quite expensive.

REVIEW_TITLE: Beautiful Views of Singapore and the Straits
REVIEW_BODY: A beautiful scenic visit to scan the magnificent panoramic views of Singapore. Not to be missed on you itinerary - you will not be disappointed
Worth getting the cable car from here to Sentosa as the views are great from the top both to Sentosa and the CPD. Good views also on the cable car.

We visited Mt. Faber as we had a day to kill and thankfully we were not disappointed. It gives a different view of Singapore and it houses the Faber Peak from where you can get cable cars to Sentosa, Bell of Happiness and also small bells which are tied there. You can also see a small Merlion there and visit a unique bridge.

You can either hike it up which is exhausting (about 35 floors) or take a cab and start walking once you are at the top.

Good views to be had and it is a must visit.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great and different view of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY: Friends took us at night, which I would say is best. Otherwise you can get the Faber/Sentosa cable car and get off at the top before you go back across to Sentosa. Cooler up there as well.
The highest point of Singapore. And the third is Singapore Cable car station. The mountains around trees. And be careful there are no taxis in

REVIEW_TITLE: View the city from the mountain
REVIEW_BODY: Use the cable car to reach the peak after that take a walk to faber point and downhill to hudson wave boardwalk. Best if you arrive in the morning.
Take a stroll on Mount Faber and see the fabulous Henderson Waves boardwalk. A really nice and tranquil walk in height with the treetops.

Stunning views with a touch of history. Worth walking around the canopy below the main mount to read and see some of Singapore's history. Not the best if locations for those with difficulty in walking.

One of the oldest parks, Mt. Faber is only 105 metres high. A popular tourist destination Mt. Faber offers visitors cable car rides to Harbourfront and Sentosa Island. A pleasant walking nature reserve with great panoramic views of the southern part of Singapore and islands. The night time views are even more spectacular. There are footpaths, a road, stairs and trails leading up to the hill. A small Merlion statue sits in one of the lookout points. At another point in the park a mural depicts scenes of local historical events. Ring the “Bell of Happiness” at the Jewel Box, it is believed that when you strike the bell it will bring you happiness! There is also a restaurant and trendy bar at the peak where one can enjoy the views, especially at night. Being directly behind our hotel (the Bay Hotel), our 15 minute walk each day made our early morning walks very pleasant.
We went up to Mount Faber and took the cable car to Sentosa island. We had a great time going over and back. Best to get off at Harbour center on the return to be able to catch a taxi.

I've been up here probably 4 times. I love it each time. The views are beautiful and it's a nice scenic walk. I've walked up the hill and that is a bit of a hike that I don't recommend unless you like uphill hikes. I recommend taking a taxi or driving up there. Once you're up there, there's a place that has like a compass and each direction tells you where certain aspects of Singapore are located in that direction. This is a place I definitely try to bring anyone who visits me.

It is hardly a mountain for avid mountaineer. It is more like a hill or elevated place where you can see Singapore from higher point. It does not even have a cool environment expected for a mountain. You can make a wish on the wishing bell, then write and hang your small wishing bell. The walk is quite fun but really not much else to do. The lychee singapore sling at the restaurant near the bell is quite good, sweet and the alcohol taste is barely there.
Surrounding views are ok. You can another merlion here. Nothing much to see. You can board the cable car to sentosa from here.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great park with splendid views of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
We normally go by cable-car. It’s also possible to walk up the path from Harbourfront, or take a taxi.
From the summit, you get great views of much of the south of Singapore and Sentosa. Often there’s a nice cool breeze!
In my opinion, the best views are seen by turning right on exiting the cable-car station. Follow the road, then the obvious path, with views at various places. Don’t miss the free binoculars, they are powerful and show detail you’ll miss without magnification. In addition to the views, watch out for birds, as well as enjoying the many trees.
Most visitors turn left from the station, and head for the peak. Views in this direction are not as good, and there are too many steps without handrails for my liking. The brown signs show toilets in this direction, and I do remember them, but I think they were closed years ago. I haven’t seen them for ages, and on this visit met somebody else also hunting for them!
The only toilets are at the cable-car station as far as I know. They’re not easy to find. If necessary ask for help.
The disabled will find the summit reasonably flat. There's a lift from the cable-car, and if you go the route I suggest, not many steps.
We’d love to have a meal here. But we go for the peace of the hilltop, and don’t like the music in the restaurants.
Overall, it’s a lovely place to spend an hour or two. However if your time in Singapore is limited, I wouldn’t rate it as a top priority. If you have the time, I’m sure you’ll love it.

This place is a good half day outing in Singapore. We visited this place in the evening. The nearest MRT station is Harbour front. It takes hardly 15 min to reach to the top. The view is amazing, one side you can see the Sentosa island and the other side you can see the city. The cable car station to Sentosa is just ahead of the viewing point. There is a bistro here which is good quiet place for dinner.

REVIEW_TITLE: Nice enough - but perhaps not a priority to visit
REVIEW_BODY:
We have visited the Botanic Gardens, Gardens on the Bay and Fort Canning Park and rate these much higher if you are visiting Singapore with limited time.
Mount Faber is worth a visit for exercise and is free if you walk. Views back are to the docks and the Sentosa theme park, not the city or Marina Bay. It took us about 90 minutes to walk up from Vivo City and back, taking a detour to cross the Helix Bridge on the way.
Initially we thought we would take the cable car up, but this is only an option if you purchase a ticket that includes entrance to Sentosa Island, minimum SGD$26pp; you cannot buy a Mount Faber only cable car ticket and in our opinion the view from the top is not worth SGD$26 - go to one of the other gardens instead; they are better and free!

Mount Faber provides fantastic views over the city and the harbour, in a lush surrounding of colourful flowers. Well worth the effort to see the views at the top of Mount Faber.

Note that it does get busy with tour bus crowds - I got there after lunch and it was fairly quiet with only a few walkers around before the tour bus arrived.

REVIEW_TITLE: Worth a visit for the views
REVIEW_BODY: I climbed Mt. Faber today and although it was hot and humid and my legs are a bit sore, it was lovely to see the city from so high up. If you find your way here, I recommend the Terrace Garden and the Forest Walk.

I spent a few hours walking around this park, which feels like a sanctuary away from all the noise. Through the trees you get great views of the city. Definitely recommend this park if you are looking for a change of pace.

REVIEW_TITLE: Not that spectacular but decent enough views
REVIEW_BODY: Hardly the spectacle our guide was building this up to but a reasonable viewing point which in part is obscured by trees but does allow for views of the Singapore skyline but not the main downtown area. The buildings are similar in nature and mostly white so nothing special. The other side is better with the dock area and cable cars going to Sentosa island, which can also be clearly seen. There is a lot more up here than just that view and of course - the cable car is here as well as the lush greenery and park area. Plus places to eat and drink. So the area as a whole is a good visit. Just don’t expect much from the view.

one of the greatest place i ever visited. get their via cable car and the ride is amazing. the peak itself is wonderful. i just wish i have someone with me lol. to share the moment with. the view is awesome!! i walked going to the peak and it was great the scenery around!!

- Easily accessible from Harbourfront MRT station.
- The cable car to Sentosa runs from here.
- Good viees of the southern parts of Singapore from various lookout points.
- Great place for some "hill" running, cycling, and walking.
- A pleasant walk to Henderson Waves and Alexandra Arch from here, where you may be greeted by the occasional squirrel or two.
- Faber Peak near the Cable Car Station has a romantic ambience.
- Several tour buses ply the route up Mount Faber, do be patient when driving.

REVIEW_TITLE: A quick stop is fine for this tourist trap...
REVIEW_BODY:
You can get there the hard way, either by walking from the VivoCity shopping mall, via the Marang trail, a steep uphill, and from the other side via the Southern Ridges walkway continuing onto the Henderson Waves Bridge via Forest Walk, which is slightly easier, mostly downhill, but longer... Or the easy way, via Sentosa - Mount Faber cable car, if you are a sucker for the views;)

If you have more time and are not completely out of shape, I highly recommend getting yourself to the beginning of the Southern Ridges, to the bus stop near Alexandra and Depot roads and make a nice walking, or running, trip to combine all the interesting sights between the Southern Ridges and the VivoCity mall. The whole walk isn't that long... 4-5 kilometers, I think, manageable for almost anybody.

The Mount Faber, is very touristy spot, with decent hill views of tropical vegetation below, Sentosa island to the one side and the Singapore's downtown skyline to the other.

There is a "Bell of Happiness", a definite photo op for all the Instagram and selfie fiends;)

To spend 10 minutes here is too many, unless you want sit down and get something to eat...
I visited mount faber via cablecar. I bought 2 unlimited pass for both sentosa and mount faber cable car lines. I visited at night and I could look down the whole city. It was beautiful.

Sunday morning bright and early I decided to walk to the summit of Mt Faber starting opposite Harbour Front. Not as difficult as I expected, around 20 to 25 minutes to the top. Other than spectacular views, there is nothing else to do there. I would not recommend with young children.
You can find another Merlion here. Actually this one of the five official Merlions in Singapore recognized by the Singapore Tourism Board, who owns the copyright of the Merlion.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great views of Singapore, the port, and Sentosa
REVIEW_BODY: There's not much to do on Mount Faber, but the views are great. It warrants a quick stop through to get the views, but I wouldn't plan much time here. The cable cars are a great way to connect this with a trip to Sentosa.

REVIEW_TITLE: Good view of the city from above
REVIEW_BODY: You can see the city from above. It's a nice place to walk, you'll need a lot of stamina, because it's kinda steep to walk to.
Took the cable car from Sentosa. Nice tip: after 6 pm only 18 instead of 29 SD. Nice short walk to some viewpoints. No MRT there so go back to Harbour Front afterwards! Or take a bus...

REVIEW_TITLE: Be prepare to climb up high..
REVIEW_BODY: didn't expect it will be quite high, for a first timer to hike, u really need to take ur timine and enjoy the nature.. the beautiful view once ur at the top, its Amazing !!! Try ur best okie, no regrets !! =')

this is not somekind of mountain in the usual way. It is already 'modernized' and it is more like a park actually. But this is you could walk or jog in the morning and feel the different situation than the usual singapore.

Mount Faber is in fact the highest peak in all of Singapore (which is quite significant), Surrounding views are ok. Nothing much to see. But it is also a gateway over to the resort style island of Singapore, Sentosa Island. Mount Faber is located on the south side of Singapore, and forms a perfect line past the Singapore Cruise terminal and Sentosa Island.
At the top of Mount Faber, it’s great to take a few pictures, and when you are done you can take the cable-car ride to the SENTOSA Island. Nothing spectacular.

REVIEW_TITLE: Had Our Cable Car Ride to Sentosa from Mount Faber
REVIEW_BODY: This review is quite late. We wanted to experience the cable car ride to Sentosa so we went to Mount Faber where we boarded the cable car. It was amazing to see the traffic and streets below us.

REVIEW_TITLE: Absolutely stunning views of Harbourfront and Sentosa! :)
REVIEW_BODY:
I spent an hour and a half taking pictures and hiking from Mount Faber to Hort Park after getting off the cable car at Mount Faber station. The view at the top of Faber Point, the highest point of the park, was simply stunning and offered a wonderfully picturesque view of Harbourfront and Sentosa.

There is plenty of gorgeous greenery and wildlife such as monkeys to explore along the way (I managed to get a good photo of a cute squirrel). Do make sure to bring some mosquito spray with you as unfortunately they are part of the wildlife as well! Drinking fountains are available along the hiking trail if you want to fill up your water bottle or you forgot to bring one in the first place and need to quench your thirst.

On my walk, I passed through the artistic Henderson Waves bridge, which is the highest pedestrian bridge in Singapore (274m in length and 36m above ground). There were plenty of benches here to relax and rest my feet for a while. Further along, there is an awesome forest walk where you can admire the lush green scenery below and around you. Alexandra Arch, located just before Hort Park, has an interesting shape just like an open leaf. I definitely recommend the journey from Mount Faber to Hort Park for nature lovers! :)

REVIEW_TITLE: A bird's eye view of Singapore
REVIEW_BODY:
Whenever I travel to a foreign place, I often appreciate seeing the country/place from a bird's eye view - and enjoy its panoramic view...

Here at Mount Faber, you will be surprised by a lovely panoramic view of Singapore - it's a world of its own!

Come to Mount Faber and have a look from the top!

Enjoy your visit to Singapore - even if it's for a day or two!
Went for a short 6km run and stopped to enjoy the view on top of Mt Faber. Its quite a walk but its worth a walk.

I found out about this place via Trioadvisor, so I thought I would come here and see it. I ran from Hort Park across The Southern ridges, over Henderson waves and up here, great views along the way, overlooking Singapore. There is also a bar at the top for refreshments.

REVIEW_TITLE: Ate at the restaurant Arbora, with beautiful scenery
REVIEW_BODY: Beautiful view of the hillside and sentosa, but quite inaccessible by public transport (and difficult to find private hire transport out as well). Didn't manage to take the cable car, but the food was quite good.

REVIEW_TITLE: Enjoyed the View and Cable car ride
REVIEW_BODY:
Dear Readers,

Don't forget to buy cable car tickets if you are planning to visit Sentosa. You will be getting a round trip ticket in about SGD 30 which will allow you to board any station in the route and come back to that point. I prefer to board cable car at Mount Faber so that I can end my journey back at this point and then take MRT for the city.

The view from the cable car was breath-taking and it was even more fun due to drizzle. At Mount Faber station, you can walk in the park and be with nature for some time. I and my business partner visited a cafe/bar (I forgot the name) and enjoyed our beers for couple of hours.

Conclusion - It is a relaxing trip. Must-visit sort of place

Enjoy the Singapore trip and Travel the world.

REVIEW_TITLE: Bell of Happiness! My cup of tea!
REVIEW_BODY:
Aha! This is new to me! Look at all those bells of happiness tied together with lovely background view of Mount Faber.

At this spot, you will see a large Bell of Happiness, and then small bells with your happy wishes written on those bells, who knows your happy wishes may come true.

So I had a go, I made my happy wishes, a few of them, and optimistic that my wishes may come true - I'm open for positive things in life ;)

At this cafe here, I could enjoy the view, so scenic, picture perfect. I had my usual cup of coffee, my colleague had a piece of cheese cake, which looked delicious.

Before going on the cable car to get back to the lower ground, I was tempted with those cute souvenirs, and so bought some to take home.

A refreshing trip to this spot. Actually we also had a meeting here, talking about work.
This is where you go to catch the cable car to Sentosa. A great way to see Singapore and the southern coast. It's a stiff walk up the hill and in the Singapore heat I recommend a Taxi.

REVIEW_TITLE: Lovely overview of Singapore Harbor area
REVIEW_BODY: We took the Mt Faber cable car & really enjoyed the city views & also the views of the Sentosa Island resorts. It was quite a beautiful area. We didn't have time to take advantage of any of the walking paths, but that looked great also. Don't miss the Toilette with a View! It's great!

If you can take the mrt to patong Pasir and walk the southern ridges
About 3 hours to Faber point and the cable car, not at all effortfull if you can cope with heat and humidity! Fabulous views and worth stopping for a at the Arboria at the end!

Poor food, dreadful service ... went on New Years Eve, a disaster of a meal...greasy, overpriced and the service so slow it was almost self serve. I wouldn't go here again if you paid me. Also, for 6 people with no alcohol, for lunch it was nearly $500. NOTHING good about this place except the view.
Went here only to catch a ride to Sentosa Island and were surprised by the nice surroundings. Worth checking out (even if you're not there for the cable car).

It was a challenging but rewarding walk up a “Mountain” from a different starting point. We started from Kampong Bahru Road this time. The initial start was a steep slope up but it was good. There were a many cyclists that took this way up and could see them struggling with their pedals. Will do it again.

This is a good place to visit for the views, but there's not really much in the way of places to escape the traffic and crowds. The walkway down to Harbourfront was closed for repairs when I visited on the weekend and so we had to take a detour via a slightly longer route (and less interesting too as it was along the road rather than through the jungle).

REVIEW_TITLE: Peaceful Spot to see the whole of Sentosa
REVIEW_BODY: Mount Faber Park is one of the stops on the Sentosa Cable car. It was a really nice ride. Once you reach the stop there is a park and a restaurant to relax. It has a koi pond and it is really amazing to interact with the fish. Pets are allowed at this spot.

There are few things that really stand out for me, so much that I feel I have to give it a special review on its own: you simply must try the cempedak pudding at Spuds & Aprons - it's like nothing I've ever had before, well balanced flavour, served with ice cream, it's worth a visit just to try this.

Also there's the cable car, but I think most locals already know this. They've also recently opened Dusk restaurant with their amazing view. Worth a revisit for old timers who've not been to Faber Peak in a long while!
Great to drive up or walk up for great views of the city and cable car to Sentosa. Quiet and green - good spot and not crowded with tourists.

It was my second visit to Mount Faber and this time was on a rainy Saturday afternoon!

We went there by car and had a drink at Dusk which opened at 4pm.

Lovely place to hang out with friends, while having a drink! We can also enjoy the magnificent view!

After dinner ride up to Mount Fabre.. which one does not notice during the day .. I stood rooted looking at the twinkling lights .. singapore 🇸🇬..a fairy land.. breathtaking view ..go there at night..

REVIEW_TITLE: Great views and a bit of history
REVIEW_BODY:
views out to sea over the Singapore strait to Indonesia and the other side to the City. The complex around the cable car station has some touristy restaurants but there is a nice bar a little further towards the TOP of the hill. It's a sweaty but worth it walk up the footpath from HarbourFront station. On the way down a nice alternative to the road to Lower Delta is to take the footpath on the city side of the hill. At the bottom is Radin Mas site of a Malay legend around the tragic death of a princess. Google it!

you can also do Mt Faber as part of the hilltop path connecting to Kent ridge. Impressive footbridge and a reasonable attempt at an urban canopy walk.
This is a place to see the view opposite of Sentosa island and there is a good restaurant and the toilet can take Sentosa island photos too.
It was pretty higher more than I thought. It was good view and not many people that I can relax and see many things:)

I've visited singapore several times. But this was my first visit to mount faber. At first i didn't have a clue about faber peak. And at my first step after landing there via cable car i thougt the place is only dome kind of restaurant. Unsurely i walked along the road and i found that this is the place to see singapore from above!! Well, i like high places. We can see the trees combine with high rise buiding and the sea from faber peak. The view is great. There is also a merlion statue at faber peak too!! If you don't want to have mainstream photo with merlion beside the river, well you should go to mount faber and have some picture with the merlion.
This visit was part of a tour we were on. Very popular spot for locals walking & exercising. Bring the camera for some good shots

On 11 January 2017, a Slovenian friend was in town. Took him to Sentosa and Mount Faber. Few of the must do attractions.

Ascend to Mount Faber by car. Shown him the 2 scenic lookouts. The city view and Sentosa (cable car) view. The glittering lights in the city at night were really vibrant. Quiet and peaceful place to witness the city lights. Clear sky, no star and weather was humid (28 degrees celsius) that night.

Enjoy this visit.

Located at Telok Blangah, this is a pretty quiet place for leisure walk. There' nice views at the TOP where one can see sunset. It's also here where you can take the cable car to Sentosa. Good for kids and adults.

Mount Faber is a secondary growth forest that forms part of several interconnecting parks that run along the top of Singapore's Southern Ridges.

It is one of Singapore's oldest parks and is very popular with locals for jogging, exercise, and just a romantic stroll in the evening with you boyfriend or girlfriend.

It is also popular for bird watching and we were fortunate enough to see a green, brightly colored kingfisher high up in the boughs of a large tree.

Faber Point, at 106 m above sea level, is the highest point on the walk.
To start off the visit to Sentosa, the view from the cable cars is magnificent. Me and my friends had great time taking pictures.

Visited Mount Faber today.

Climbed up to Faber Peak, where's the station for the Sentosa cablecar is located. No much crowd this day.

There's a little souvenir shop and a restaurant. Restaurant offers good view of Sentosa and cablecar. People bought bells to declare their wishes. Also a little pond where koi fishes swimming about.

There's also a Bistro nearby. Limited parking space available.

Peaceful and lovely place to witness the city lights at night. Enjoyed.

If you are on a budget, and still like to have a sky view of singapore without going on a cable car, or the Singapore Flyer, or MBS Skypark, then this is THE BUDGET place for you!
On this hill (yah, NOT MOUNTAIN), you can get to see some cool landscapes of Singapore. Day and Night views are different, so do come up if you can find the time.
And if you HAVE money to burn, take the cable car into Sentosa!

Brilliant place to visit ride on a cable car the scenery absolutely stunning. When we were there a ship was In we went over top of it. Stunning views of beaches and docks area. Loads of photos taken plenty to look.

REVIEW_TITLE: Great park across from Sentosa island
REVIEW_BODY: It is good to walk in a Mount Faber Park across from Sentosa island, less people to walk hiking here. It was surrounding with all natures, tree, and had a good spot on the top of mountain to see view of Singapore city.
Is quite a distance to walk to the top but once you reach the top, the view is breathtaking! you can take the cable car from here or grab a meal at the restaurants.

I've been here many times over the years whilst living in Singapore and I still enjoy the views out towards the city and over Sentosa. The most recent visit was as part of the Southern Ridges walk, this time starting at Kent Ridge mrt and then finishing 9km later at Harbourfront mrt. The walk down through the jungle to Harbourfront mrt is also quite nice, especially later in the day when there aren't too many people about.
